H0.text: Condense is the process that water vapor cannot undergo without particles.

H1.text: Dissipate is what water vapor could not do without particles.

H2.text: Dilute is what water vapor could not do without particles.

H3.text: Evaporate is what water vapor could not do without particles.

A4.text: In clouds, this can be catalyzed by water-nucleating proteins, produced by atmospheric microbes, which are capable of binding gaseous or liquid water molecules.

A5.text: ions produced by an incident particle act as nucleation centers for the condensation of the vapor producing the visible 'cloud' trails.
